# 🚀 Token Migration Week: Big Changes for ElizaOS Coming Thursday! 🚀

Get ready for the exciting **AI16Z to ElizaOS token migration** launching November 7th with a 1:6 conversion ratio! You'll have 90 days to complete migrations, with exchanges handling automatic conversions for those not holding their own keys. Official exchange list coming Friday.

## 📈 This Week's Tech Updates:
- **x402 Payment Framework:** New middleware being implemented for secure payments with EVM/Solana verification and facilitator support
- **Character-Level Wallet Integration:** Characters can now have personal wallets with configs in character files, with ENV vars setting defaults that character secrets can override
- **Voice Infrastructure:** Work underway on both browser-based voice generation and optional server voice endpoint for paid users
- **Dynamic Prompt Framework:** New system for adjusting prompts to fit model contexts, preventing hallucinations with lower-context models

## 👥 Community Highlights:
- Moca launching 10k Eliza agents, significantly expanding the ecosystem
- Great discussions about AI events on Luma.com as potential avenues for user onboarding

## 💸 Token & Ecosystem Updates:
- Migration portal will be provided for manual migrations - exchanges handle automatic conversions
- Lighter (perps dex) will not support AI16Z after migration; listing ElizaOS at their discretion
- Caution advised on high APY (35%) USDC protocols with XUSD exposure - potential risk noted

## 🔮 What's Next:
Look for our Friday announcement with the complete list of exchanges supporting automatic migration. Keep your eyes on mirror.xyz/elizaos.eth for all the latest updates as we prepare for this exciting transition!

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-04

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Migration
- AI16Z tokens will migrate to ElizaOS tokens on November 7th with a 1:6 conversion ratio (1 AI16Z = 6 ElizaOS)
- Users will have a 90-day window to complete manual migrations
- Exchanges will handle automatic migrations for users who don't hold their own keys
- Official information about which exchanges support automatic migration will be shared on Friday
- Some users debating whether to buy more AI16Z before migration or wait
- Lighter (perps dex) will not support AI16Z after migration; listing ElizaOS is at their discretion

### Technical Discussions
- Debate about storing x402 payment configurations in project initialization vs. character files
- Characters can have personal wallets with configurations in character files
- Environment variables can set defaults that character secrets can override
- Brief mentions of Elysia as a potential rewrite target
- Discussion about Puppeteer/Playwright for headless hardware-accelerated video encoding and streaming in containers
- Suggestion to use Nia with MCP to index documentation for hybrid search capabilities

### Ecosystem & Events
- Moca launching 10k Eliza agents (mentioned by Reneil)
- AI events on Luma.com discussed as potential opportunities for user onboarding and investor presentations
- Concerns raised about high APY (35%) on USDC in a related protocol, with warnings about systemic risk exposure to XUSD
- Some users reported issues with ElizaOS mirror.xyz sites not working properly

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: Can someone explain what will happen to the coins on November 7th?**  
A: 1 token AI16Z equals 6 tokens ElizaOS, with a 90-day migration window.

**Q: Which wallets or exchanges will do the migration automatically?**  
A: Basically anything not an exchange you'll have to migrate manually. If you don't own the keys it'll be automatic.

**Q: Will there be a snapshot?**  
A: No snapshot. You'll have 90 days to migrate your AI16Z.

**Q: Why is there a high APY on USDC? 35% is really huge.**  
A: Because they are exposed to systemic risk with XUSD... avoid it as funds may become trapped.

**Q: x402 payment configs in project init (with runtime::registerPaymentConfig) OR in character file?**  
A: If characters can have personal wallets, then configurations can go directly into the character for 402x.

**Q: Do characters currently own personal wallets or is it agent/server wide?**  
A: You can use ENV vars to set defaults but can override in character secrets, enabling wallets per agent.

## Community Help & Collaboration

1. **Token Migration Clarification**
   - Helper: moclov8
   - Helpee: Mohammed S. Abdulmoneem
   - Context: Confusion about which exchanges will handle the token migration automatically
   - Resolution: Explained that exchanges holding user tokens will handle migration automatically, while self-custody wallets require manual migration

2. **Exchange Delisting Clarification**
   - Helper: Kenk
   - Helpee: TOM
   - Context: Confusion about Lighter delisting AI16Z
   - Resolution: Clarified that Lighter is a perps dex so AI16Z won't be tradable there after migration, and listing ElizaOS is up to them

3. **Website Functionality Check**
   - Helper: Odilitime
   - Helpee: cavey65
   - Context: User claimed ElizaOS mirror.xyz sites don't work
   - Resolution: Confirmed that mirror.xyz/elizaos.eth works fine

4. **Puppeteer/Playwright Guidance**
   - Helper: LarpsAI
   - Helpee: jin
   - Context: Seeking Puppeteer/Playwright expertise
   - Resolution: Suggested using Nia with MCP to index documentation and repositories, plus using reference tools for web search synthesis

5. **Discord Channel Visibility Issue**
   - Helper: sam-developer & Odilitime
   - Helpee: Borko
   - Context: Missing cloud channel in Discord client
   - Resolution: Confirmed channel was visible and suggested checking if channel was unselected in client settings

## Action Items

### Technical
- Implement migration of AI16Z tokens to ElizaOS tokens on November 7th with 1:6 conversion ratio and 90-day migration window (Mentioned by multiple users)
- Implement headless hardware accelerated video encoding/streaming from inside containers using Puppeteer/Playwright (Mentioned by jin)
- Evaluate Clank Tank for scoring student capstone projects in dev-cursor-UI bootcamp (Mentioned by Rabbidfly)
- Consider implementing x402 payment configurations in character files (Mentioned by Odilitime, Stan ⚡, Borko)
- Evaluate Elysia as potential rewrite target (Mentioned by cjft)
- Address concerns about high APY USDC exposure to XUSD (Mentioned by orion)

### Documentation
- Create list of exchanges supporting automatic migration (Mentioned by Kenk)
- Fix non-working ElizaOS mirror.xyz sites (Mentioned by cavey65)
- Document wallet configuration options for ENV vars vs character secrets (Mentioned by Odilitime)

### Feature
- Launch of 10k Eliza agents (Mentioned by Reneil)
- Consider engaging with AI events on platforms like Luma.com to onboard users (Mentioned by DorianD)
- Explore creating a dark pool version of HyperLiquid chain for privacy (Mentioned by DorianD)

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-03

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Economics & Ecosystem
- Value accrues to the token through multiple revenue streams including Eliza cloud revenue (for buybacks, LP depth, and contributor rewards), OTC agent desk, x402, and ERC-8004 products
- Long-term value will come from burns and fee integration as the AI agent economy grows
- Token migration is upcoming; EOA wallet holders will need to manually migrate through a portal when available

### Agent Development
- Otaku (web-based) and Spartan (Discord/Telegram) are completely different agents targeting different audiences
- The team plans to ramp up agent production over the next 6 months
- Users reported issues with Telegram agent responsiveness and Bedrock plugin for image generation

### Repository Management
- The team is improving repository tracking for the elizaOS project
- Jin gathered GitHub data from elizaOS and elizaOS-plugins organizations to analyze repository activity metrics
- Plans to automate tracking of new activity across organizations instead of using manual pipeline configuration
- Discussion about creating a GitHub App to increase API request limits and automate repository tracking suggestions

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: How is value expected to accrue to the token?**  
A: Value capture comes through Eliza cloud revenue for buybacks, LP depth, contributor rewards, OTC agent desk, x402, ERC-8004 products, burns, and fee integration as the AI agent economy grows.

**Q: What's the relationship between Spartan and Otaku?**  
A: Otaku is web only, Spartan is discord/telegram. Different products with different audiences.

**Q: Will the migration be automatic?**  
A: If holding in an EOA wallet you will need to migrate manually using the portal when it is live.

**Q: Hello, coders which file refer on "elizaos start"?**  
A: It's in the package.json file.

**Q: Should we release the current develop branch today?**  
A: Implied agreement from Stan ⚡ who responded "ah, thanks".

## Community Help & Collaboration

1. **Bedrock Plugin Troubleshooting**
   - User fermartz reported problems with the Bedrock plugin for image generation
   - 0xbbjoker suggested debugging approaches including cloning and linking the plugin locally
   - Alternative plugins (OpenAI or OpenRouter) were recommended for image generation

2. **Telegram Agent Support**
   - Slava Yakimenko created a Telegram agent that wasn't responding
   - Arceon directed the user to the appropriate support channel

3. **Repository Tracking Improvements**
   - Jin gathered GitHub data and created PR #169 to update tracked repositories
   - Stan ⚡ mentioned he's already adding repos when he notices missing ones with activities

## Action Items

### Technical Tasks
- Fix Bedrock plugin image generation issue with "Malformed input request" error (mentioned by fermartz)
- Resolve non-responsive Telegram agent issue (mentioned by Slava Yakimenko)
- Implement token migration portal for EOA wallet holders (mentioned by Mohammed S. Abdulmoneem)
- Release current develop branch (mentioned by cjft)
- Merge pull request for plugin-evm (PR #24) (mentioned by cjft)
- Update the list of tracked repositories and perform full reingest (mentioned by jin)
- Try alternative image generation plugins (mentioned by 0xbbjoker)

### Documentation Tasks
- Update regional availability information for Bedrock models (mentioned by 0xbbjoker)

### Feature Requests
- Ramp up agent production in the next 6 months (mentioned by Borko)
- Replace manual pipeline config with automatic tracking of new activity in organizations (mentioned by jin)
- Create GitHub App to increase API request limits (3x) (mentioned by jin)
- Add automated step in GitHub Action workflows to suggest new repos to track (mentioned by jin)
- Create dedicated GitHub App to auto-create PRs for new repositories (mentioned by Stan ⚡)
- Consider applying sustainability management principles to the organization (mentioned by DorianD)

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-02

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Otaku DeFi Agent Beta Testing
- Eliza's new DeFi agent Otaku is currently in beta testing
- Users reported issues with outdated token price data and problems with LP staking functionality
- Team acknowledged these issues and promised to address them
- Otaku will soon be open-sourced as part of Eliza's ecosystem

### Token Migration and Economics
- Upcoming token migration from AI16Z to ELIZAOS scheduled for November 7th
- Migration portal will be provided for token holders
- Team clarified that AI16Z tokens won't be terminated after migration but liquidity may be limited
- Discussion about market cap equivalence between old and new tokens

### Platform Development
- Eliza Cloud was described as a consumer platform for creating, deploying, and interacting with AI agents without coding
- Team is working on database architecture improvements with Row-Level Security (RLS) based on Entities
- PR #6107 implements a hierarchical structure where multiple entities connect to multiple servers that connect to a single database
- Technical issues with plugin connections being addressed, including timeout problems and error handling

### NFT and Engagement Systems
- Discussion about creating anime otaku avatars using technology similar to "warplet NFT gen" on Farcaster
- Ideas for NFT breeding/spawning mechanisms where accounts can stake coins together
- Concepts for LLM-generated game items with attributes and lore
- Team noted they need to focus on shipping current products before implementing new ideas

### XCP Asset Management Solution
- Frustrations expressed about complex XCP (Counterparty) asset trading process
- Proposal for a multi-agent architecture with wallet, escrow, and trade agents to simplify transactions
- Four-step flow outlined from wallet initialization to trade conclusion with escrow protection
- Stretch goals include social media integration, multi-wallet support, and Emblem vault integration

### Social Media Challenges
- Several users expressed concerns about Eliza's suspended X (Twitter) accounts
- Team explained there's an ongoing lawsuit where X is demanding $50k monthly payments
- Discussion about alternative platforms like Farcaster and Nostr as potential alternatives to X

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: Is Otaku a product of Eliza Labs?**  
A: "Yup this is Eliza's newest flagship agent" (answered by Borko)

**Q: Is Eliza Cloud the same as Otaku?**  
A: "No, Eliza Cloud is a consumer platform where anyone can create, deploy, and interact with AI agents without touching code or infrastructure" (answered by Borko)

**Q: Is Otaku part of open source?**  
A: "Otaku will soon be made open source" (answered by Borko)

**Q: What about degenai?**  
A: "Degen is being planned out, will have more updates later" (answered by Borko)

**Q: What's the lawsuit with X (Twitter) about?**  
A: "Making elizaOS pay $50k a month" (answered by witch)

**Q: Does new token will be equal market cap with old one?**  
A: "If it's not there's an arb opportunity and likely market will fix" (answered by Odilitime)

**Q: After end of migration ai16z will be terminated?**  
A: "No but I imagine there won't be a lot of supply to do much with" (answered by Odilitime)

**Q: What happens if I hold ai16z tokens in phantom wallet?**  
A: "We'll have a migration site" (answered by Odilitime)

**Q: Is this just adding a serverId to the messages table?**  
A: "No, that was the first PR (#6101). This second PR permits adding a second level of RLS based on Entities." (answered by Stan ⚡)

**Q: What was the warplet NFT generation system on Farcaster?**  
A: "It was created by someone named Sayangel with 'harmonybot' and a coin called $chaos, taking a fingerprint of Farcaster accounts to generate avatars" (answered by DorianD)

## Community Help & Collaboration

### Otaku Agent Troubleshooting
- **Helper:** sayonara | **Helpee:** neerg  
  **Context:** Otaku agent providing incorrect/outdated token prices  
  **Resolution:** sayonara acknowledged the issue and promised to tune the prompt

- **Helper:** Borko | **Helpee:** hildi  
  **Context:** User's USDC disappeared after attempting LP staking with Otaku  
  **Resolution:** Borko offered to fix the issue via DM

- **Helper:** sayonara | **Helpee:** hildi  
  **Context:** User's USDC disappeared after attempting LP staking with Otaku  
  **Resolution:** sayonara explained LP staking isn't available yet and requested wallet address to investigate

### Technical Support
- **Helper:** Stan ⚡ | **Helpee:** sayonara  
  **Context:** Plugin MCP connection not holding/disconnecting  
  **Resolution:** Stan identified multiple root causes (timeout issues, limited ping retries, no error handling) and suggested specific fixes including adjusting timeouts, increasing retries, and changing ping methods

### XCP Asset Trading Solution
- **Helper:** Rabbidfly | **Helpee:** DorianD  
  **Context:** DorianD expressed frustration with complex XCP asset trading process  
  **Resolution:** Rabbidfly proposed a multi-agent architecture with wallet, escrow, and trade agents to simplify the process, outlining a four-step flow and potential stretch goals

### NFT Engagement Ideas
- **Helper:** shaw | **Helpee:** DorianD  
  **Context:** DorianD suggested creating anime otaku avatars similar to warplets  
  **Resolution:** Shaw validated the idea and expanded on it, suggesting they could create high-quality NFTs using profile pictures as input

- **Helper:** DorianD | **Helpee:** shaw  
  **Context:** Shaw mentioned difficulty in branding elizaOS compared to ai16z  
  **Resolution:** DorianD suggested gamification mechanics involving staking and breeding NFTs to enhance engagement

## Action Items

### Technical
- Fix Otaku's data retrieval for token prices and market caps (Mentioned by neerg)
- Investigate and resolve the issue with disappearing USDC during LP staking attempts (Mentioned by hildi)
- Implement the token migration portal for November 7th (Mentioned by Dr. Neuro)
- Open-source the Otaku agent (Mentioned by Borko)
- Continue development of DegenAI (Mentioned by Borko)
- Adjust plugin MCP connection settings (ping timeout, retries, reconnection attempts) (Mentioned by Stan ⚡)
- Test client on plugin-MySQL with new serverId implementation (Mentioned by Odilitime)
- Review PR #6107 implementing entity-based RLS (Mentioned by Stan ⚡)
- Develop XCP wallet agent that can accept private keys (Mentioned by Rabbidfly)
- Create escrow agent to hold assets during transactions (Mentioned by Rabbidfly)
- Build trade agent for price negotiation and UI (Mentioned by Rabbidfly)
- Implement atomic swap functionality for asset trading (Mentioned by Rabbidfly)
- Migrate and ship existing products before implementing new NFT systems (Mentioned by shaw)
- Consider hiring Sayangel who created the warplet system (Mentioned by shaw)

### Feature
- Add LP staking functionality to Otaku (Mentioned by hildi)
- Consider pairing new agents with $ELIZAOS token instead of $ETH or $SOL (Mentioned by Connor On-Chain)
- Add Twitter/X integration for social trading (Mentioned by Rabbidfly)
- Support multi-wallet functionality to separate funds from cards (Mentioned by Rabbidfly)
- Add cold/multi-sig wallet support (Mentioned by Rabbidfly)
- Integrate with Emblem vault for Ethereum/OpenSea access (Mentioned by Rabbidfly)
- Create automated advertising agent to find buyers (Mentioned by Rabbidfly)
- Implement order book functionality (Mentioned by Rabbidfly)
- Create interface similar to bankr bot for sending assets on social media (Mentioned by DorianD)
- Create anime otaku avatar generation system similar to warplets but more inclusive (Mentioned by DorianD)
- Implement NFT breeding/spawning mechanism where accounts can stake coins together (Mentioned by DorianD)
- Develop LLM-based system to generate game items with attributes and lore (Mentioned by DorianD)

### Documentation
- Clarify the token migration process from AI16Z to ELIZAOS (Mentioned by ihsangoovers)
- Document the entity→server→DB hierarchy and permissions model (Mentioned by Stan ⚡)

# Discord Chat Analysis - "core-devs" Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat segment contains minimal technical discussion, primarily focused on brief exchanges about payment configurations for x402 and character files. Odilitime raised a question about where to store payment configurations - either in project initialization (using runtime::registerPaymentConfig) or in character files. Borko and Stan contributed to this discussion, suggesting that if characters can have personal wallets, then x402 configurations could logically be placed in character files. Odilitime confirmed that while environment variables can set defaults, character secrets can override these settings, enabling per-agent wallets. Additionally, there were brief mentions of Elysia (a potential rewrite target), next-generation chips, and some administrative matters like standup invites and a missing cloud channel.

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-04

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Migration
- AI16Z tokens will migrate to ElizaOS tokens on November 7th with a 1:6 conversion ratio (1 AI16Z = 6 ElizaOS)
- Users will have a 90-day window to complete manual migrations
- Exchanges will handle automatic migrations for users who don't hold their own keys
- Official information about which exchanges support automatic migration will be shared on Friday
- Some users debating whether to buy more AI16Z before migration or wait
- Lighter (perps dex) will not support AI16Z after migration; listing ElizaOS is at their discretion

### Technical Discussions
- Debate about storing x402 payment configurations in project initialization vs. character files
- Characters can have personal wallets with configurations in character files
- Environment variables can set defaults that character secrets can override
- Brief mentions of Elysia as a potential rewrite target
- Discussion about Puppeteer/Playwright for headless hardware-accelerated video encoding and streaming in containers
- Suggestion to use Nia with MCP to index documentation for hybrid search capabilities

### Ecosystem & Events
- Moca launching 10k Eliza agents (mentioned by Reneil)
- AI events on Luma.com discussed as potential opportunities for user onboarding and investor presentations
- Concerns raised about high APY (35%) on USDC in a related protocol, with warnings about systemic risk exposure to XUSD
- Some users reported issues with ElizaOS mirror.xyz sites not working properly

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: Can someone explain what will happen to the coins on November 7th?**  
A: 1 token AI16Z equals 6 tokens ElizaOS, with a 90-day migration window.

**Q: Which wallets or exchanges will do the migration automatically?**  
A: Basically anything not an exchange you'll have to migrate manually. If you don't own the keys it'll be automatic.

**Q: Will there be a snapshot?**  
A: No snapshot. You'll have 90 days to migrate your AI16Z.

**Q: Why is there a high APY on USDC? 35% is really huge.**  
A: Because they are exposed to systemic risk with XUSD... avoid it as funds may become trapped.

**Q: x402 payment configs in project init (with runtime::registerPaymentConfig) OR in character file?**  
A: If characters can have personal wallets, then configurations can go directly into the character for 402x.

**Q: Do characters currently own personal wallets or is it agent/server wide?**  
A: You can use ENV vars to set defaults but can override in character secrets, enabling wallets per agent.

## 🚀 Highlights
This week's activity focused on initiating new features and planning for future enhancements. Concurrently, several new issues were created to guide future work, focusing on core performance through parallel actions and background tasks, as well as user engagement with a points and leaderboard system. The period was characterized by laying the groundwork for upcoming features rather than completing existing ones.

This work is complemented by a new issue, [#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112), opened for discussion on the same topic.
-   **Runtime Enhancements:** To improve the runtime environment, work was started in [#6111](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6111) to add an ElizaOS reference, a foundational step for future runtime capabilities.

## 🐛 Issues & Triage
No issues were closed this week. The focus was on opening new discussions to shape the project's direction.

-   **New & Active Issues:** Four significant new issues were opened, outlining key areas for future development:
    -   **Core Functionality & Performance:** Discussions were started around improving the system's operational capabilities with proposals for "Parallel actions" ([#6108](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6108)) and "Background tasks" ([#6109](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6109)).
    -   **User Engagement & Security:** Future enhancements were proposed for user interaction via a "Points / Leaderboard" system ([#6110](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6110)) and for data security with "Entity-level RLS" ([#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112)).

## 💬 Community & Collaboration

# elizaos/eliza Monthly Report (November 2025)

## 🚀 Highlights
November kicked off with a dual focus on enhancing system stability and laying the groundwork for significant new capabilities. A critical bug affecting agent settings persistence was resolved, directly improving the framework's reliability. Concurrently, new development was initiated to introduce entity-level security and enhance the core runtime. The opening of several strategic issues signals a forward-looking push towards improved performance through parallel actions and background tasks, as well as new user engagement features.

## 🛠️ Key Developments
Work this month balanced immediate fixes with the introduction of new features.

- **Agent Stability Improvement**
  A significant bug was fixed that prevented agent settings from persisting across restarts, ensuring that runtime-generated configurations are now correctly retained. This change, made to the core runtime initialization logic, enhances the overall reliability of agent operations ([#6106](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6106)).

- **New Feature Initiatives**
  Development began on several new fronts with the opening of new pull requests:
  - **Security:** A proposal was made to implement entity-level row-level security, aiming to add more granular data access controls ([#6107](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6107)).
  - **Runtime Enhancements:** Work started on adding an ElizaOS reference directly to the runtime, likely to streamline framework interactions ([#6111](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6111)).

## 🐛 Issues & Triage
Issue tracking this month was focused on defining the next wave of development priorities.

- **Closed Issues:** No issues were closed during this period.

- **New & Active Issues:** Several key issues were opened, outlining major areas for future work:
  - **Core Functionality & Performance:** Discussions were initiated around implementing "Parallel actions" ([#6108](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6108)) and "Background tasks" ([#6109](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6109)), indicating a focus on scaling the system's operational capacity.
  - **Security & User Engagement:** New issues were created for "Entity-level RLS" ([#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112)), which complements the ongoing PR, and a "Points / Leaderboard" system ([#6110](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6110)) to enhance user interaction.
  - According to the reports, none of the active issues have generated more than three comments, suggesting discussions are still in their early stages.

## 💬 Community & Collaboration
The provided reports indicate a period of focused, heads-down development. While new pull requests and issues were opened, the data does not show any high-volume discussions or specific collaborative events. The alignment between the new pull request for RLS ([#6107](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6107)) and the corresponding new issue ([#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112)) suggests coordinated planning around new features.
